Intervention: ZOLADEX (goserelin acetate) 10.8 mg intramuscular deposition for injection every 12 weeks
ZOLADEX (goserelin acetate) 3.6 mg intramuscular deposition for injection every 4 weeks
Eligibility: Premenopausal women 18 years of age or older with positive breast cancer (ER +ve) histologically/cytologically confirmed
World Health Organization (WHO) rate of return 0, 1, or 2
Treatment with tamoxifen or other hormonal treatments as an early adjuvant of breast cancer (ECB) in the previous 24 weeks
Has received radiation therapy in the last 4 weeks
• History of systemic malignancy other than breast cancer in the previous 3 years
Results: Percentage of participants with progression-free survival (PFS) at week 24
The number of participants for whom neither the objective progression of the disease nor the death (due to any cause) were observed at week 24 on the number of participants randomized x 100.

Time: Evaluations of objective tumours performed every 12 weeks (+/- 7 days) until week 24, then every 24 weeks (+/- 14 days) until week 96 or objective progression is confirmed according to the criteria for evaluation of response in solid tumours (RECIST).
Description of the arm/group: ZOLADEX (goserelin acetate) 10.8 mg intramuscular deposition for injection every 12 weeks
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 69.4
Description of the arm/group: ZOLADEX (goserelin acetate) 3.6 mg intramuscular deposition for injection every 4 weeks
Unit of measure: percentage of participants 73.5
